conclusion: Analyze the thermodynamic cycle and use ideal gas properties to determine temperature at State D.
The image shows a P-V diagram with cycle ABCDA, including isobaric and isothermal processes.
AB is an isobaric process; therefore, P1V1 = P2V2.
BC is an isothermal process; therefore, T = T0.
CD is an isobaric process; therefore, P1V1 = P2V2.
DA is an isothermal process; therefore, T = TD.
Net change in internal energy is zero; thus, TD = T0.
The temperature at State D is equal to T0.
